column1: Uchi////Now if you've had good sushi
column2: it's kind of like how you would treat a really good steak. You don't mess with it much. The main philosophy is
column3: let's try to let the ingredients speak for themselves. This can mean that if you have one piece of tuna or yellowtail
column4: it might very well taste exactly (or almost) like another restaurant you've been to. This is only experienced by what we had that night for sushi
column5: but Uchi tries to have a blend of both tradition and avant garde.
